wikitext.*:
The '''honey-cakes of the Beornings'''<ref name=":0">{{Cite DTP|id=LR 2.08.026}}</ref> were a type of waybread baked by [[Beorn]] himself<ref name=":1">{{Cite DTP|id=H 07.126}}</ref> and later by the [[Beornings]].<ref name=":0" /> Although their exact recipe was a secret, it is known that they were twice-baked and made with honey. They remained good to eat for a long time and were very nutritious and quite tasty, although they caused thirst.<ref name=":1" />

== History ==
Beorn provided [[Thorin and Company]] for their journey through [[Mirkwood]] with honey-cakes, alongside other provisions.<ref name=":1" />

At the time of the [[War of the Ring]] the Beornings were not very willing to share their cakes with travellers, although [[Gimli]] had tasted their honey-cakes and considered the Beornings the best bakers that he knew of. However, after tasting [[Elves|Elvish]] ''[[lembas]]'' he decided that ''lembas'' was even better.<ref name=":0" />
